summary: Conflicts in Iraq and Syria have led to the destruction, looting, and trafficking of cultural property by Islamic State of Iraq and Syria, as well as others. In an effort to protect this property and in response to Congress, the Department of State established a cultural heritage coordinating committee in 2016 consisting of nine federal entities. We found that the committee has made progress by...
title: Iraqi and Syrian Cultural Property: U.S. Government Committee Should Incorporate Additional Collaboration Practices
